edu.depaul.cdm.madl.tools.ui.internal.text.functions

Class BufferedDocumentScanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.depaul.cdm.madl.tools.ui.internal.text.functions.BufferedDocumentScanner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICharacterScanner

    public final class BufferedDocumentScanner
extends Object
implements ICharacterScanner
    A buffered document scanner. The buffer always contains a section of a fixed size of the document to be scanned.

        public BufferedDocumentScanner(int size)
        Creates a new buffered document scanner. The buffer size is set to the given number of characters.
        Parameters:
        size - the buffer size

      • peek

        public final int peek(int distance)
        Peek ahead in the buffer without changing the current offset. The distance, which must be both non-negative and less than the maximum size of the buffer, is the number of characters past the current position to look. A distance of zero (0) will return the same character that read() would return, but without advancing the position.
        Parameters:
        distance - the number of characters past the current character to look
        Returns:
        the character at the specified position, or ICharacterScanner.EOF if the position is past the end of the document

      • read

        public final int read()
        Specified by:
        read in interface ICharacterScanner

      • setRange

        public final void setRange(IDocument document,
            int offset,
            int length)
        Configures the scanner by providing access to the document range over which to scan.
        Parameters:
        document - the document to scan
        offset - the offset of the document range to scan
        length - the length of the document range to scan

        Specified by:
